intro: Chenopodium oahuense subsp. ilioensis, commonly known as Oahu spinach, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its succulent, edible leaves that are often used in traditional Hawaiian cuisine. The plant typically grows in rocky or coastal areas, thriving in well-drained soils. It produces small, greenish flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
